title: Two different values on a register, on the same instruction? (Cheat Engine)
content: My situation is that I'm trying to find the send function of an online game. I found the buffer pointer and looked what accesses to it. It was obviously an instruction, which used the buffer pointer, but if I breakpoint on that instruction it doesn't contain the buffer ptr. Why are the values different if I breakpoint? First Picture: edx stores the adress of the buffer. Second Picture: Breakpoint on that same exact instruction, but edx is not the same, which doesn't really make sense.

comments.text: Your question got a little confused, could you explain it to me again so I can correct your question and try to help you find your answer?
what is the instruction that you found and why do you think it's not accessing the buffer?
it's hard without pictures, so here my question including pictures: forum.cheatengine.org/viewtopic.php?p=5769983#5769983
You can add pictures to your question. Please try to put all information here so we don’t have to go somewhere else to find it.
This is totally normal, imagine this is a casual function, functions can be called with different parameters each time, so the addresses will be obviously different.
